feed.title: Your awesome title
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Place4
entry.content:
VAGABOND
  • ABOUT
  • PLACES
  • CONTACTS

Hi guys :

I would like to share my experience to Singapore (25th to 29th September)...

we reached Singapore airport around 5 in eve, immigration check didn’t took much time as we were on our way to hotel by cab around 6!

At airport - we can find travel guide counters (very friendly and will guide you through every little details) as we were 4 people, lady over counter suggested to take cab and not monorail, Indeed cab in Singapore to get around is the best way unless you want to explore monorails which is also a good option if you are single or couple riders! She also informed us about ongoing Elephant Parade (themed decorated around 160 diff. elephants all over city)

About which I didn’t get update through trip adviser recent forums (maybe I missed) I visited night safari (don’t miss animal show & don’t afraid to get in bats cave) same night after getting fresh at hotel... We visited both night safari and Zoo so here is my impression if you are willing to visit one of them visit ZOO! (One of best zoo in world) Getting zoo... cab is the best way from anywhere in city u can reach there for around 20 $.

2nd day - universal studio From 10 am to 11 am I think its golden window We went through roller coasters and mummy ride without any queue, like an "express pass holder" even though it was school holiday day marked in universal ticket calendar! After around 11 you can easily see crowd rushing up to every attractions! It rained almost every day at 3 in noon for 1-2 hours! So plan accordingly and make most of your day up to that timing! Songs of the sea (beach station) awesome show... I’ll say get premium seats for 7:30 show so u can catch up Crane dance (9 pm) at waterfront sentosa! second day at Santos required to catch up other attractions like Luge & sky ride, ifly, Silosio beach,Casino, cablecar etc.

3rd day- Zoo, Flyer Merlion Park, Clark quay! Zoo took almost half day & started to rain so have to leave and reached hotel... for waiting almost 2 hrs it stopped & we headed for flyer (it was closed as it was still raining lightly) But they resumed soon as rain stopped! I think day time is best for flyer as the view of city is stunning! We also planned for deck at marina bay hotel but due to rain we couldn’t make there! (Only few meters higher than flyer)

4th day- shopping at Orchid road, Little India Visited 24 hr Mustafa shopping centre at little India But I didn’t find prices to be cheap as I was told by friends! Getting taxi at Mustafa centre is challenge (we were stuck there at 11 pm), must take cab service number handy if planning to go there! Overall it was fabulous family holiday! Thanks! Have great trip! Cheers!

entry.title: Img4
entry.content:
VAGABOND
  • ABOUT
  • PLACES
  • CONTACTS

Coaker's Walk
A pleasant walk through the fog facing a beautiful valley view.. Coakers walk gives you a pleasant walk through the edge of a cliff, which either gives you a stunning view of the valley below or an amazing fog. Take some cash in hand as there is plenty of opportunity to shop for dress, jewelleries, show case items, and even get a tattoo. There are a couple of points where you could get a binocular view of the valley for a small entry fee. Overall, it's a nice experience.

Guna Cave
The cave is not approachable for the common tourist. It is well grilled and out of bounds. However, the place offers a different experience of snarled tree roots over a slope. There are almost 100 of trees whose roots are meshed up and provides support to climb up. It's one of the excursions in Kodaikanal which can be a unique experience. Tip: Use sports shoes to climb with good grip. The root branch are usually slippery and caution must be taken for climbing.

Silent Valley
Silent Valley View is located in close proximity to the Pillar rock garden in Kodaikanal. The point is famous for proffering some astounding and stunning views of the Silent Valley. Tourists are advised to travel the billowy path carefully. The best time to visit the valley point early mornings or late afternoons, as during this time the scenic beauty of the place is at its maximum.What a beautiful place in the lap of mother nature. The place just mesmerizes you with the scenic beauty.

entry.title: About
entry.content:
VAGABOND
  • ABOUT
  • PLACES
  • CONTACTS

Hi..there..! AkshayaChandrasekar.


I'm on a mission to explore the world, one adventure at a time. I'm a passionate traveller, writer, and photographer, and I love sharing my journeys and discoveries with fellow wanderlusts like you.

My Travel Story:

From the bustling streets of Tokyo to the mountain scenes of Jammu and Kashmir, I've had the privilege of visiting 4 countries and counting. Each destination offers a unique experience, and I'm always excited to immerse myself in different cultures, try new cuisines, and capture the beauty of our planet through my lens.

My Travel Philosophy:

I believe that travel is more than just ticking off bucket list items; it's about connecting with people, building bridges between cultures, and fostering a deeper appreciation for our planet.
My blog is a reflection of this philosophy, as I share not only the must-see attractions but also the hidden gems and the personal stories that make each place special.


"I find immense joy in exploring new places, cultures, and experiences. Traveling allows me to broaden my horizons, gain a deeper understanding of the world, and create lasting memories. It's a source of inspiration, growth, and a reminder of how diverse and beautiful our planet is."

entry.title: Img1
entry.content:
VAGABOND
  • ABOUT
  • PLACES
  • CONTACTS

Tea Estate
Of course, when you think of Munnar the first thing that comes to your mind is the vast expanse of tea estates. And visiting them is exactly what you should be doing while you are there. You will find many beautiful tea estates or tea gardens in Munnar to explore. Some of the major tea estates in Munnar include AVT tea, Michael’s tea, Brooke Bond and Harrison Malayalam, among others.

Lakkam Waterfalls
Though it is one of the crowded places, it still makes for one of the preferred Munnar tourist places for many. It is, moreover, the one and only major waterfall. To enjoy it the best, try to get there early in the morning. Get a bath if you fancy or just sit on the rocks nearby and enjoy the cool breeze that flows around in the area. Again, the place will be pretty crowded.

Station Point
As the name suggests, it is one of the highest points in Munnar where you can get some Instagram-perfect selfies. But since it’s a popular place, it is always crowded. So rather than going to the main point and clicking photos there, what you can alternatively do is find a not so popular (but giving equally beautiful views) spot around. Walk a little far from the main spot and I guarantee you will get many such places.

entry.title: Img2
entry.content:
VAGABOND
  • ABOUT
  • PLACES
  • CONTACTS

Lake Picholo
The city gets very hot during the summer. The summer months are best avoided when you want to travel to Udaipur. Winter is the best season to travel to Udaipur. The weather is pleasant and you get the best view of the scenic spots in the city when you travel in this season. September to February are the best months to travel to Udaipur. You can enjoy the stunning view of Lake Pichola, Fateh Sagar Lake, Doodh Talai musical gardens, and more.

Golden Tulip
After breakfast, you will proceed on a full day tour of Udaipur, visit the 400-year old marble-built City Palace, constructing of courtyards, pavilions, terraces, corridors, rooms and hanging gardens. From the balconies, you can appreciate panoramic views of Lake Palace hotel and Jag Mandir on one side, and the bustling Udaipur city on the other.

Jagdish Temple
The Jagdish temple is a famous Lord Vishnu's temple located in the heart of the city The temple is famous for its carvings and architectural designs. The temple is filled with multiple carvings on the walls and pillars which is something unique for the eyes.City Palace is the most popular place in Udaipur and it is the most visited place in Rajasthan.

entry.title: Img3
entry.content:
VAGABOND
  • ABOUT
  • PLACES
  • CONTACTS

Gangtok
Darjeeling is also known as the Queen of the Hills is a very popular hill station located in the state of West Bengal, in the North Eastern part of the country.town in the district of Darjeeling in West Bengal, the place at an altitude of 1,458 m is a great way to extend the vacation, added to Mirik tour package. Being near to Siliguri is another advantage that comes with visiting it.

Howrah Station
If you are new to this station, don't be confused. It is one of the best and well planned railway station in India. The place where you can get almost all trains to every other big city. There are various food corners available including KFC, pizza hut, mio amore, food plaza and lots more

Kangchenjunga
The next highest mountain in Nepal after Mount Everest is Mount Kangchenjunga, which rises to an elevation of 8,598m.Many protected areas like Kangchenjunga Conservation Area, Khangchendzonga National Park, Pangolakha Wildlife Sanctuary, Varsey Rhododendron Sanctuary, etc have been established to protect the unique Kangchenjunga

entry.title: Place3
entry.content:
VAGABOND
  • ABOUT
  • PLACES
  • CONTACTS

Hi guys :

The land of kings, camels, brave warriors, majestic forts, rich tradition, and vibrant colours, Rajasthan is one of the best tourist spots in India.

The traditional lifestyle and welcoming locals add great charm to this tourist destination. Enticing vacationers from all over the world, this place has its own uniqueness which cannot be found anywhere else. Like many, Yashukushalappa and her friends also got smitten by the grandeur and opulence of this place and that’s how they planned to spend 6 days in Rajasthan.

My friends and I being avid travellers always look up to new destinations to explore. And this time, we wanted to visit Rajasthan which happened to be our first choice.

Frankly, we were quite willing to witness the majestic palaces and forts in Rajasthan that we’ve always seen in photographs and movies. Moreover, we were extremely exceptionally excited for Camel safari.
Being happy customers of Travel Triangle and after a happy trip to Andaman which was planned by them, we actually didn’t have second thoughts about which travel organizer to choose.

Just like the previous time, our Rajasthan trip plan for 6 days organized and managed commendably by TT team. With so much excitement and reminiscing the delightful memories, here I am penning down all the best experiences that my friends and I had on our Rajasthan trip.
